{"step_by_step_thinking": "Filarial worms are a type of parasitic worm that cause a variety of diseases in humans. Brugia malayi, Onchocerca volvulus, and Wuchereria bancrofti are all species of filarial worms that are known to cause diseases in humans. Brugia malayi causes Brugian filariasis, Onchocerca volvulus causes river blindness, and Wuchereria bancrofti causes lymphatic filariasis. However, Mansonella ozzardi is a species of filarial worm that does not cause significant disease in humans.", "answer_choice": "C. Mansonella ozzardi"}
